Title: Food security: We’ll remove bottlenecks in agric sector, says Tinubu ‎
Summary: President Bola Tinubu pledged to eliminate all barriers stalling Nigeria’s agricultural potential, especially in livestock production, in a push towards food sovereignty and global exports . The president made the declaration during a bilateral meeting with the Brazilian President .

Title: ‘Into a void’: Young US college graduates face employment crisis
Summary: Over two years, Rebecca Atkins filed more than 250 job applications, and felt like every one was going into a gaping chasm . The highest unemployment rate for recent college graduates in the United States in more than two years .

Title: BRICS nations voice ‘serious concerns’ over Trump tariffs
Summary: BRICS leaders meeting in Rio de Janeiro on Sunday are expected to decry US President Donald Trump’s ‘indiscriminate’ trade tariffs . Emerging nations, which represent about half the world's population, say they are concerned about the global economy . BRICS nations voice ‘serious concerns’ over Trump tariffs

Title: Flood: NEMA conducts simulation exercise in Kano
Summary: The National Emergency Management Agency conducted a ‘Full-Scale Flood Response Simulation’ exercise in Wudil Local Government Areas, Kano State . The Agency’s Director-General, Mrs Zubaida Umar, during the simulation exercise on Saturday .

Title: 2027: Anambra PDP not in coalition, says state chair
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Anambra Chapter, has said that it is not involved in any coalition arrangement with any individual or political party . The state chairman of the party, Mr Chidi Chidebe, said this in an interview with the state chair .

Title: Foiled attempt to re-loot artefacts: Oba of Benin says ‘God heard my prayers’
Summary: Oba of Benin received 119 artefacts from the government of Netherlands which were part of precious artworks looted from the palace . •Narrates travails when palace funds were slashed .

Title: NSA RIBADU: Nigeria on the brink when Tinubu assumed office
Summary: National Security Adviser (NSA), Mallam Nuhu Ribadu, has said that President Bola Tinubu’s assumption of office saved Nigeria from imminent collapse .

Title: I decided to be so good nobody could question my craft — Niniola
Summary: Nigerian Afro-House sensation, Niniola sat down with VJ Adams on the show Off The Top for an intimate interview . She openly shared the challenges and inspirations that have shaped her music career .

Title: Nigeria becoming a land flowing with tears and blood — Anglican Bishop of Warri
Summary: "Why should the government sit and watch militant herdsmen steal and vandalise, kill and boast about it? "Would it be far from the truth to say that these attacks are religiously motivated and amount to religious cleansing?"

Title: PRESIDENCY 2027: If not Tinubu who else? By Dele Sobowale
Summary: Nigerian governance has been suspended for active politicking in Nigeria until May 2027 . We might as well stop deceiving ourselves and squarely face the issue of selection of our President from 2027 to 2031 . If not Tinubu who else?

Title: MURIC demands Sharia courts, Friday work-free day in South West
Summary: Islamic human rights group, the Muslim Rights Concern, has called for constitutional amendments to establish Sharia courts in all South West states . The group’s Founder and Executive Director, Prof Ishaq Akintola, presented the proposal during the South West Zonal Public Hearing on constitutional review . He said the changes would enhance inclusiveness

Title: Fatalities rise six years after NCDC declared emergency on Lassa fever
Summary: Nigeria Centre for Disease Control declared Lassa fever a public health emergency on January 22, 2019, following a spike in confirmed cases and rising fatalities across several states . PUNCH Healthwise gathered that there are still major gaps in diagnosis, public awareness, and healthcare infrastructure . Experts blamed poor surveillance systems, insufficient research funding, and the government

Title: Why lonely people may die of cardiovascular diseases – Physicians
Summary: World Health Organisation said that no fewer than 871,000 people die worldwide annually from loneliness . One in six people worldwide is affected by loneliness, which, along with social isolation, can lead to physical illness . Title: Inside bone setting homes where patients leave with permanent disabilities
Summary: Ismail Haneefah, 47, suffered a fractured right leg after a car somersaulted multiple times in 2003 .
